turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: His name's Harry Sultenfuss.

turns.speaker: HILLARY
turns.text: Oh.  Ohhh?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What're you saying?

turns.speaker: HILLARY
turns.text: Ummmmm, look, I...I...

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Are you saying my mother had another husband?

turns.speaker: HILLARY
turns.text: Oh honey, back then...people did crazy things.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: They sure did! They got kicked out of school, they married truck drivers...these are my mother's greatest accomplishments? I'm sure glad I came all the way out here to find them out.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Sure am, who are you?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I am Vada Margaret Sultenfuss. My mother was...

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Maggie...Maggie's little girl.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I was hoping I'd get to meet you.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You mean, you knew about me?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Umm...can you come in for a minute?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'd like to, thanks.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Bye.  She looks a little like me when I was a little girl.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Does she?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm glad you're here.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You are?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah, come on, let's talk.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: We have this school assignment to write about someone we never met and I chose my mother. She was born in Los Angeles and since my uncle Phil moved out here I came in to visit him and then I looked at her high school yearbook and...  and I called a few people and one guy said that she went to UCLA, another guy said that I should call Hillary Mitchell so....

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hillary Mitchell? How's she?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Oh she's great...she's a little crazy though. Anyway, Hillary said that you had a black Ford truck and this policeman I know got in touch with Motor Vehicles and...he gave me your address and here I am.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I told you it was a long story.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That's all right, you know what? You sound just sounded just like your mother...she told great stories. Stories with crazy accents and...special effects.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Special effects?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah like, switching a lamp on and off when she was talking about lightning...audiences love stuff like that. And your mom knew how to work an audience.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I don't know very much about her...I was hoping that you could help me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'll try.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: And she saved it.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well, we didn't have a camera...so she just wrote the date on the bag and said, "This will be out wedding album, this will be a day we will never forget." We never did.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Do you have any pictures if her?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I've got something better.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: She's beautiful.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: We performed on the beach one summer...ha...everything went wrong.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Would you like...eh...to have these movies?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: More than anything in the world.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It's good to see Maggie again...and you.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Umm...didn't you ever wonder about me?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well I didn't know about you until after she was gone.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I thought that...umm...maybe you'd be curious about how I turned out.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'd say you turned out just fine.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I guess what I mean is, my mother married my dad after you...and then I was born, so I thought that...maybe you got divorced because of me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Wait...woah...woah...wait a minute...Do you think I'm your father?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Honey I'd be proud to be your father, really. It just isn't so.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Maggie wanted to have a baby...and...umm...I didn't.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: oh.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: She didn't wanna miss out on anything...especially motherhood...it got to be a real problem with us.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Come on in!

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: That's okay.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: It's just a corpse.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You should be here when they bring in a body that's been dead for a couple of days, and they haven't found it yet, 'cause it was in an apartment, and no-one came to visit, or floating in a river, and then the body starts turning this weird shade of green, you know, like watery pea soup? The arms and legs deteriorate first, the body looks like a raisin with four fat legs. Anyway, this is why I'm seriously considering cremation. Judy??

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: My mother can't have any more kids.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Neither can mine. She's dead. It's Shelly who's pregnant.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What are you staring at?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: It's Kevin, I don't want him to see me.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: See you? He can smell you from there.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Oh God, he's coming over here, act natural, totally natural.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: He likes you.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Likes me? He said I looked like a grasshopper.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Boys always pretend they hate you when they really like you.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: That's ridiculous, so, if you really can't stand someone, then you pretend that you're really crazy about them?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I don't know. And I don't care, Kevin's a jerk and I don't like him anymore. He's all yours!

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Hi, wanna help me pick out wallpaper for my new room tomorrow?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: ehh...I don't know I mean....

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Then what did she do?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well...I'm not supposed to talk about it, but since I'm gonna write about it I might as well tell you. She was a spy against the Russians.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: So she had you in jail, in Russia?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well actually I was born in Siberia and then they shot her and sent me home to my Dad.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Is it okay if I drink this?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: It's okay with me, hi Kevin.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Well if it isn't Vada, the grasshopper girl.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Vada, he was giving you an easy out so you wouldn't have to write about your mother.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: But I wanna write about her.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You're crazy, what was her big achievement? Did she invent gravity?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: No-one invented gravity, it just exists.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Oh please, who do you think you're kidding? And where did she spy on the Russians from, here in Pennsylvania??

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: No, not here in Pennsylvania, she went to Russia undercover with her acting troupe and got a lot of highly sensitive secret plans sent back. Just when she was about to go home, she got caught, and they killed her.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: All right, so when did she have you between all her acting and spying and getting caught?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: That's simple. She was pregnant with me...when she went to Russia and she didn't know...and then when the Russians found out, they waited to shoot her 'cause you're not allowed to kill pregnant women anywhere in the world.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Ehh...I'm staying at the chateau and the guy who runs the garage there said that you're the best Jag people in town...so uhm.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well Enrique is great and...we are the best.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Then I have come to the right place.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I guess you have.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm Sam Helburn. Sam.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Rose.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: This is really very nice of you.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: It's no problem, I had a mother once myself.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: If it's in here at all, it's in the back two rows.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: O.K. Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Happy hunting.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: He's writing. Hello?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: If you're selling Girl Scout cookies I'm borderline diabetic.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You're Alfred Beidermeyer aren't you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hi there...can I help you?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Are you Jeffrey Pommeroy?

turns.speaker: MR. OWETT
turns.text: Vada?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: The poem is really about attitude. It's about not giving up and...it's easy to be overwhelmed sometimes but...that's when we should...force ourselves to push on.

turns.speaker: MR. OWETT
turns.text: Vada what about you, who have you come up with?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: My mother.

turns.speaker: MR. OWETT
turns.text: Your mother?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I never met my mother.

turns.speaker: MR. OWETT
turns.text: Hey Vada. How's your report coming?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Great, I have so much to say, I hardly know where to start.

turns.speaker: MR. OWETT
turns.text: You know I've been re-reading Virginia Woolf, I think she'd be a natural for you, she led a fascinating life.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Thanks, but I think I'm gonna stick to my mom, she led a fascinating life too.

turns.speaker: MR. OWETT
turns.text: I'm sure she did.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Thanks

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Give it back Nicholas!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: But we made a business deal.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What ever happened to a good old-fashioned favor huh?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Nicholas! What are you doing up?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I...ahhh...umm...I'm thirsty.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: There's water in your bathroom.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I want juice!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't wake up Vada.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I won't.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: If the fruit burst into flames I'll be prepared.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're so clever.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're grounded 'till you're fifty!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You're over reacting!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Make that sixty and I'm docking your allowance for two weeks.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: MOM!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You think this is easy for me? You go out on the town and I get to be the bad guy. Look I don't want you to be some punk hoodlum delinquent but I can't do my job as a parent if you don't do your job as a kid.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Thanks....

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No THANKS!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: He said it was a gift.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah, RIGHT.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I don't need you to be telling me to...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: TAXI!!!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: My parents had a brief, but intensely fulfilling relationship. She's remained a woman of mystery to this day.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: And you're gonna solve the mystery?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I got it all figured out, I know she went to Wilson High School, so first thing tomorrow, I'm gonna go there and get a copy of her yearbook. That way I can get the names of all the people she was in clubs with and found out who her friends were.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You know eavesdropping is a very unattractive habit.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I wasn't eavesdropping, I was overhearing.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I didn't ask for the money, Phil just gave it to me.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well look, I know that all you care about is your precious mini-bike. It's obvious you have no sense of historical perspective, I think we're here.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Getting off please.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Excuse me, pardon, thank you, excuse me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They obviously have no sense of historical perspective either.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: It's not funny! I mean what am I gonna do? Without that yearbook I'm lost. I can't just walk around town looking for someone with a Wilson High School Letter sweater!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Vada.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: WHAT??

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Calm down! We just have to ask ourselves, where your books come from.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't mean to alarm you, but I'm getting a nose bleed from the altitude.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Just remember the needle in the haystack.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I never did understand that story, did someone find the needle or not?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What difference does it make?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: A big difference, if someone found it we should keep looking, if they didn't we're just wasting our time.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Oh my gosh, here it is!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Look, here she is. Margaret Ann Muldovan - Newspaper, Literary magazine, French Club, Drama Club, Debate Club, Girls Basketball and Swim team.  With Maggie's combo of good looks and talent, we're sure to be seeing her name in lights. She was gonna be famous.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yearbooks always set you out for disappointment, I want mine to say: Nick probably won't amount to much, so don't be surprised if you never hear anything about him again. Can we go?...It smells like someone left their gym bag in here.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: It's the leather bindings, I love the fragrance of vintage books.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I love the fragrance of chilidogs.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Don't forget, the girls change their names if they got married.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'd never do that.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Get married?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Change my name.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What, you think the guy should change his name?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I don't think anybody should change their names, that way you can always find them when you need them.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What if you don't wanna be found?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Why do you argue with everything I say?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You saved a lot of lives, you should be very proud.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Umm, I'm trying to find out her greatest achievement.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You ratted on my mother??

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Who are you? Hitler's hall monitor?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Care for a smoke?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: This'll be great in my report, my mother was suspended for smoking.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I think it's cool.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You would.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You'd rather have a mother that's a member of the police state? Rules are made to be broken.  Just ask him.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Just call us the "dead end kids".

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: May I use the phone please.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Boy, you're really into this.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: He is one of the great poets.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: If he has a heart attack you're carrying the body down yourself.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: At least it gives you plenty of exercise.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Look at it this way, however bad I feel, it isn't as bad as becoming extinct in a bottomless pit of tar.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: And I thought I was weird.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You are weird. Let's just go.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Oh, no wait, I like that you bought me here.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey what do I care...I mean, consider the sorts, a chick from Pennsylvania, who wears a mood ring.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: This isn't just a mood ring.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Does it work?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well, it doesn't open cans or anything but it...it's sort of a reminder of a friend of mine.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Boyfriend?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well he was a boy, he was my friend...he was my best friend. When we were kids we were gonna...move out here and move to the Brady Bunch.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do you think your friend's up in Heaven now, looking down on you and watching you all the time?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well, I hope he's not watching me all the time.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Let me see if it changes colors on me.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: ehh...Okay...but be careful, it has a lot of sentimental value.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Maybe it'll fit my pinkie.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Don't force it, you'll break it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm not gonna break it, I just wanna see it change colors.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I want it back now. I never should have taken it off, I want it back.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey relax, I'm not gonna break it.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Give it to me!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Come and get it.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Just give it to me!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Just come and get it...right here!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: DON'T, come on!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Woah, watch it!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: DON'T!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Uh oh...

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What do you mean "Uh Oh"???

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: ...I dropped it.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: In the tar??

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It was an accident, I'll get you a new one.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Where are you going???

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Owh...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What are you doing? You can't go in there!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Oh no?!?!?!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's dangerous!!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Leave me alone!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You mean,  this ring?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Jerk! You IDIOT!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Never heard of her.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Montgomery Clift, wait 'till I tell Shelly.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Here's Judy Garland!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: My mother stood on this very spot.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm afraid your feet won't fit in there.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: That's 'cause I was cursed with the Sultenfuss Bear Claws.  My hands fit.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Big deal.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What's he smoking?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Hey look!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: This is a totally barbaric custom.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: And you'd be my cousin?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Yeah I guess...sort of.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: But we wouldn't really be related right?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Oh no, we wouldn't be from the same bloodlines or anything. We'd be like two total strangers who...accidentally had relatives that got married.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Good. I mean...

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Marriage can really complicate things. So, aren't you gonna say anything about my earrings?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I already did, it's a totally barbaric custom...but on you, it looks good.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: It's not his fault!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No...it was me. And I'm sorry mom, really, ju...just tell me what to do, I'll do anything.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: No, but sometimes he drives a hearse.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He's an undertaker.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Maybe not...but maybe it does. If no one told me about this, I mean...maybe they're trying to hide something.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Maybe this Jeffrey guy is...is my real father. I mean...look at me, I have the hair of a dead person and...and my nose, no one in my family has this nose, it could be the nose of...a...of a complete stranger,

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That thing you said about your nose...it was a stranger's nose...well it's not...it's...I mean...it's yours...you know?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Nick?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: This has been a real confusing day.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: And I'm gonna use the movies when I give my report. Jeffrey says audiences love special effects.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You better ace it...you sacrificed our whole vacation.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: ...umm...Listen, I'm sorry...you had to sacrifice your entire vacation.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Some sacrifices are worth it.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You mean...it wasn't that terrible?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I wouldn't say it was terrible...it was...kind of...

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: An adventure?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Part adventure...part miracle.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Write me a poem?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'll write you ten poems.  Bye.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Good-bye, look in your backpack.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Muh??

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I'd consider it a personal favor.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Ten bucks.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What's it for?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: For the mini-bike fund.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Wow!

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Well I know you're not crazy about taking Vada around tomorrow, so...I just want you to know I appreciate it though.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You're a good man Nicholas.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Phil, I think you should consider... fades as Vada walks off

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well Rose was being very thorough.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Was Rose.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Doctor Helburn, what a surprise. In the last couple of days we've changed your oil, realigned your brakes, balanced and rotated your tires, aligned your front end, and flushed out your entire cooling system, I really didn't expect to be seeing you for another three thousand miles.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh what can I say Phil, it's just that I feel so welcome here.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Okay, that does it, that does it, the strudel does it, first it's brakes then.... I mean I am not gonna let some Podiatrist with a Jaguar full of strudel come waltzing in here and....

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not a Podiatrist, I'm a Cardiologist.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Who cares? Rose, tell him we have an arrangement.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, wha...what kind of arrangement?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And you certainly shouldn't settle for anything less that you deserve.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You stay out of this, look, if I had a red XK-150 with a black interior, I sure as hell wouldn't be handing out relationship advice.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't think the color of the interior is....

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Rose this not the place to be having this...

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Vada!! Vada runs and jumps into Phil's arms Look at you, oh hi, hi, hi!! How are you? You look great, how's Shelly? Your dad?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: They're great.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: How about Nick? Did he take good care of you?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: He was very polite, worth the entire five dollars.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Uh huh, well...good to know. Phil hands Nick a               5 note

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: She lives here too?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Ahh, that's right, like one big happy family. This is Nick's room and uhh....

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: But...are you engaged or something?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Dating, seriously dating. You're thirsty, want something to drink? Sure you do, it's been a long trip.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Sounds like you have a fear of commitment, Uncle Phil.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: That's ridiculous, I'm...I'm very, umm, what do you call it?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Committed?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Committed.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: So does that mean that you sleep here every night?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Yes, it does.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well then that's not exactly dating is it.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Vada, I know that traditionally you're not supposed to do a lot of these things before you're officially married...but these are very, very special circumstances.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I had to be, I only have five days. So just point me in the right direction and....

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I'll do better than that. I'll send you off with your own private guide.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Lock the door.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Uhh sweetie, I wou... I wou...I wou...

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Don't worry, I'll do it in my own subtle way.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I feel like before I can talk to him I have to see his face.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: How's this for a solution. We'll take a drive over to his place, you can introduce yourself....

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'd like to see his house but...I don't know if I'd have the nerve to just go up and knock on his door. I don't think I can go through with it.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Then we'll keep driving...you'll decide.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Do you think I should tell my dad about Jeffrey Pommeroy?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I don't know, he's got an awful lot on his mind right now.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Then again, your dad's got his own memories and he's got his own life now...I think this is a secret just between you and your mom.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: A secret, I like that.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: This is it I guess.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Well, I've come this far...the least I can do is knock on the door.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You want me to come with?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I should do this myself.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Okay...take your time...I'll...I'll go for a walk around.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: No, you're the best and I don't want you talking to anybody on the plane.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Dad already gave me this lecture. He's gonna meet me at the airport, then we'll go for some pizza, then we'll have dinner in bed with Shelly.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Sounds great, well you give 'em both one of these for me.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Who knew that when I started working in the finest foreign car shop in LA, I would also find the light of my life.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah, well he left out a couple of steps, ah look, I've gotta get back to these bills, Phil will you help Vada get settled?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Come on...I'll show you where you're gonna stay.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Then you'll be all set.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Sounds like you're very organized.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No, there's no problem, Dr. Helburn just needs to have his oil changed.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Oh I see, 'cause usually that doesn't require such a lengthy consultation.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: What's with the touching, why was he touching you?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: He wasn't touching me he was just...gesturing...

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: He was caressing.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Phil for God sake.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: God? No I didn't think you'd want to invoke God Rose, because he saw even more than I did. ROSE Look Phil, if you want the rights of a husband, you're gonna have to ask me something but if not, you're gonna have to get accustomed to the rights of what you are.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Oh...what's that?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Right now? An intimate border with...mechanical skills.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Hi!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh, Hi, how's the investigation going?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh, yeah, sure, help yourself.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Anyone with taste, anyone with breeding.... A gentleman, would choose British racing green, with maybe a tan interior...but when you buy a red car, with a black interior and wire wheels, you have one thing on your mind and one thing only and I'm too much of a gentleman to say what that one thing is...in front of the children.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: We may go out for coffee after the meeting so don't expect us before midnight.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: There's plenty of fruit.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You know where the fire extinguisher is.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Wait, are you saying that I don't appreciate?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm saying he asked me out for coffee, like a real date, when was the last time you did that?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Wha...what do you mean? We have a date every night.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No, that's not a date, a date is when I don't cook.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yes, what kind of arrangement? I'd be very interested to know what kind of an arrangement we have.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You know exactly...what kind it is. Come on Rose...what do you want from me?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't want anything you don't wanna give me.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I think this place is just fine.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: You know how I feel about you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You like the way I cook...you think I make out a great invoice.  PHIL You and Nick and...and this...this garage are my whole life...I love you. Sure you don't have the greatest taste in music...but there's not another woman who could look so sexy in that smock. What I'm try... what I'm trying to sa...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You really think I look sexy in this smock?

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Is that a yes?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You're Nick's mother?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What, did you think he was raised by a pack of wolves? Don't be misled by the haircut.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'm just tired.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: All right, well get to bed early and don't let anybody in. Bye.
